intro: Barberina hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy barberina, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Barberina hirsuta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
